body.value: The following map shows temperatures in in during the summer. Bluer areas are colder than average; redder areas are warmer. HOLC boundaries are also drawn onto the map. Red polygons are neighborhoods that were rated “D”.

If we group the mean temperature of the neighborhoods by their HOLC grade, we would see the density plot below. The plot also shows Below is a density plot of temperature values shown in the map above based on neighborhood HOLC grade for both 2000 and 2020.

After running a Tukey’s Honestly Significant Differences Test at a 95% confidence interval, we can observe in both years which HOLC grades’ neighborhoods were significantly cooler or hotter than neighborhoods in other grades.
